snippet: In announcing that William J. Bratton would be the police commissioner come January, Bill de Blasio promised that he would succeed in changing stop-and-frisk policing.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column; Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio, in announcing that William J Bratton will be police commissioner in January, promises he will succeed in changing stop-and-frisk policing; notes that by the time de Blasio announced he was running for mayor, however, number of stops and frisks, mostly of black and Latino men, had already started drastic decline that has continued for most of last two years.
lead_paragraph: In announcing that William J. Bratton would be the police commissioner come January, Bill de Blasio promised that he would succeed in changing stop-and-frisk policing.

headline.print_headline: Vowing to Slay the (Already Subdued) Stop-and-Frisk Dragon
headline.main: Vowing to Slay the (Already Subdued) Stop-and-Frisk Dragon
